wikipedia_page.main:
George Fredericks (born 1929) is an English naïve artist.
He has exhibited his paintings since 1957, and developed an early following by British and international artists, including Peter Blake and Larry Bell.His paintings have been exhibited in many major European centres, including in galleries in Amsterdam, Hamburg, London (the Redfern, the Crane Art and Rona Galleries)   and Zurich, and in museums in France.
